intro: Sida brevipubens, commonly known as the short-hairy sida, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with slender, branching stems and small, pale green leaves. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, with five petals and stamens that are shorter than the petals. Sida brevipubens is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides, and it plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
